column4: peeps_-> and you just want to add another partition to be mounted at boot?
creek23-> i dont really know the proper procedures, perhaps ask one of the ops here..

peeps_-> then add them one by one, make sure you add your / and /home if they were in separate partitions
CyBurnett-> a good time now to learn command line , do some linux tutorials  please
peeps_-> not really, it has to be done manually
CyBurnett-> doing a tutorial on linux is really helpful, if you want to be specific, look for mounting file system tutorials

maybe the disk_uuid not supplied by ubuntu kernel config file?
